com.cleo.lexicom.external

Interface ILexiComIncoming

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RemoteLexiComIncoming

    public interface ILexiComIncoming
    Establishes an interface for streaming solicited or unsolicited incoming payload. Refer to IActionController.get(String[],String,ILexiComIncoming,java.util.Properties) or IMailboxController.receive(ILexiComIncoming,boolean) or IListenerController.setDestination(ILexiComIncoming).

    Implementation can be configured to run directly within the VersaLex service/daemon by setting "Custom ILexiComIncoming Class" in Configure>Options>Other and copying an archive containing the implementation into VersaLex's lib/api/ folder. If configured this way, VersaLex will instantiate and register the implementation at service/daemon startup.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        java.io.OutputStream open(java.lang.String[] source,
                          java.lang.String[] mailbox,
                          java.io.File file,
                          java.lang.String messageID,
                          java.util.Properties parameters)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Incoming payload file
        Parameters:
        source - alias path of action or local listener that is receiving
        mailbox - alias path of mailbox corresponding to incoming payload
        file - default file which would have been used
        messageID - message id (can be null)
        parameters - (e.g. for AS2 - AS2-From, AS2-To, Subject, Content-Type, Content-Disposition, etc.) (can be null)
        Returns:
        java.io.OutputStream return null if default destination file to be used
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • multipart

        ILexiComMultipartIncoming multipart(java.lang.String[] source,
                                    java.lang.String[] mailbox,
                                    java.lang.String messageID,
                                    int numParts)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Incoming multipart payload (multiple files)
        Parameters:
        source - alias path of action or local listener that is receiving
        mailbox - alias path of mailbox corresponding to incoming payload
        messageID - message id
        numParts - number of payload files (-1 if unknown)
        Returns:
        ILexiComMultipartIncoming return null if default destination file to be used
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • receipt

        void receipt(java.lang.String[] source,
             java.lang.String[] mailbox,
             java.lang.String messageID)
      throws java.lang.Exception
        (Pre)process payload prior to return receipt generation
        Parameters:
        source - alias path of action or local listener that received
        mailbox - alias path of mailbox corresponding to received payload
        messageID - incoming message id just completed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if payload is not accepted
